title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 13 July 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:00 <vmassol> I think that's the problem  
00:08 <vmassol> sdumitriu: seems I cannot run again release  
00:08 <vmassol> becuase it's already been pushed  
00:09 <@sdumitriu> We can delete the tags from github  
00:09 <@sdumitriu> I'll do that  
00:09 <vmassol> can you do just commons for now?  
00:09 <@sdumitriu> K  
00:09 <vmassol> I want to verify if my change will work now  
00:09 <@sdumitriu> Done  
00:10 <vmassol> how do you do that btw?  
00:12 <vmassol> sdumitriu: you did this: http://nathanhoad.net/how-to-delete-a-remote-git-tag ?  
00:13 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
00:13 <@sdumitriu> Actually I didn't delete it from the agent  
00:13 <@sdumitriu> Just from github  
00:13 <vmassol> I cannot find an option in the UI  
00:13 <vmassol> link?  
00:17 <mflorea> has quit  
00:20 <vmassol> sdumitriu: cool it worked  
00:20 <vmassol> the signing of the git tag  
00:20 <vmassol> so I had to modify my gitconfig to make it work  
00:20 <CIA-114> Vincent Massol xwiki-commons-4.1.3 \* r315c83c https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/315c83cbb9d722694e3d77583b67f1d1e829fcfe / (62 files in 62 dirs): [maven-release-plugin] prepare release xwiki-commons-4.1.3 - http://git.io/SMQK4g  
00:20 <CIA-114> Vincent Massol xwiki-commons-4.1.3 \* r497da65 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/497da65a82e777a84d465f303cc13ae1e579842a / pom.xml : [release] Preparing release xwiki-commons-4.1.3 - http://git.io/Y6xKoA  
00:21 <vmassol> errrr  
00:21 <vmassol> https://github.com/ says that Thomas created a tag just now  
00:22 <vmassol> .gitconfig is me  
00:23 <vmassol> sdumitriu: any idea?  
00:24 <@sdumitriu> I think he forgot to remove his ssh key from his github account  
00:24 <vmassol> why would he need to remove his ssh key?  
00:24 <vmassol> (from his account)  
00:24 <@sdumitriu> Not his, the agent's key from his account  
00:25 <vmassol> we need to do that?  
00:25 <vmassol> it wasn't in the documeted steps I  
00:26 <@sdumitriu> Check step 5 on https://help.github.com/articles/generating-ssh-keys  
00:26 <polx> has quit  
00:26 <@sdumitriu> hudsonagent@ks365275:~$ ssh -T [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
00:26 <@sdumitriu> Hi tmortagne! You've successfully authenticated, but GitHub does not provide shell access.  
00:26 <vmassol> indeed  
00:26 <@sdumitriu> It used to be on the release plan page  
00:27 <vmassol> so as a first step we need to put the agent's ssh key to our account for releasing?  
00:27 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
00:27 <@sdumitriu> Hm, the ReleasePlan document changed a lot  
00:28 <vmassol> I'm working on it  
00:28 <@sdumitriu> When it was using a table it had "remove agent's key" as a step, IIRC  
00:28 <vmassol> I'll add it  
00:28 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/ReleaseProcess#HAutomatedRelease didn't mention it  
00:29 <vmassol> so what happens if I add the agent key in my account now?  
00:29 <vmassol> will it superseded thomas' ? :)  
00:29 <@sdumitriu> One of two things: it will give you an error ("key already added" or something like that), or accept it but still detect tmortagne as the user  
00:30 <@sdumitriu> I got that error a few times, but I don't know if it was related to the fact that it was a duplicate or not  
00:30 <vmassol> ok so not other choice than thomas removing it from his account  
00:30 <@sdumitriu> You could regenerate a new ssh key  
00:30 <vmassol> so all I did today was done as thomas  
00:30 <vmassol> yeah but I'll wait, it's late here  
00:32 <vmassol> ok it accepted it but it's still thomas  
00:32 <vmassol> sdumitriu: can you tell me how to remove a tag from the github ui so that I can do it tomorrow for the reamining modules?  
00:34 <@sdumitriu> I don't know if it can be done from the UI, I deleted it from the command line  
00:34 <@sdumitriu> git push origin :xwiki-commons-4.3.1  
00:34 <vmassol> ah I thought you said you did from github  
00:35 <vmassol> ok thanks, time to bed for me  
00:35 <vmassol> nn  
00:36 <vmassol> has quit  
00:39 <abusenius> has quit  
00:50 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki

08:48 <rrodriguez> has quit  
09:08 <vmassol> the automated scripts are really bad at this point. It will have taken me 2 days to do a point release whereas manually it's only 2-3 hours...  
09:08 <vmassol> that's the problem with automation  
09:08 <vmassol> if it's not bulletproof it's useless and worse than not having it

12:40 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: I don't agree with that, the release script is supposed to do what the RM would do manually  
12:40 <vmassol> that=?  
12:41 <@sdumitriu> "the automated scripts are really bad at this point. It will have taken me 2 days to do a point release whereas manually it's only 2-3 hours..."  
12:41 <vmassol> sure, but you said it yourself, it's "supposed" to  
12:41 <vmassol> but it doesn't  
12:42 <vmassol> and having to debug hundreds of lines of script code to understand what the $$§( the script is doing wrong is a pain  
12:42 <vmassol> and  
12:42 <vmassol> whe I'm doing it manually I don't 1% of what the script does  
12:42 <vmassol> \*I don't do  
12:42 <vmassol> because it's a script so it has to check things, set variables, etc  
12:43 <vmassol> I'm still debugging atm  
12:43 <vmassol> it's a major major pita  
12:43 <@sdumitriu> What's wrong?  
12:43 <vmassol> sorry to say but nothing is working and the state is pure crap ATM  
12:43 <vmassol> just unusable  
12:44 <vmassol> I'm progressing step by step, you can follow my progress here: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/ReleasePlans  
12:44 <vmassol> (4.1.3)  
12:45 <+sburjan> vmassol: someone reported a issue on the win 7 installer, going to check it out before you're done releasing  
12:45 <vmassol> sburjan: if you're talking about 4.1.3 it's already released in maven and I'm not going to do it again  
12:47 <+sburjan> vmassol: ok  
13:16 <+sburjan> I wasn't able to reproduce on a wind 7 32 bit. Gonna setup a vm with win 7 64 bit

15:45 <vmassol> ok I'm done spamming :)  
15:45 <vmassol> now when you need to do a release you go to http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/WebHome  
15:45 <@cjd> I see you got 413 out while I was wandering around in Montreal.  
15:46 <vmassol> cjd: are you in Paris now?  
15:46 <@cjd> Yes.  
15:46 <vmassol> ah cool, I was in Paris yesterday but not today unfortunately  
15:46 <Inge-> has joined #xwiki  
15:46 <@cjd> I missed my flight because the 2 busses were both late by 1 hour. First one causing me to miss the second one and be even later.  
15:46 <vmassol> yep seen that  
15:47 <vmassol> we'll need to talk a bit later about the release process to tune stuff I didn't know how to do and to merge scripts  
15:47 <vmassol> so http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/ReleasePlan413 was done like this  
15:47 <@cjd> There are some scripts which I am too afraid to run myself.  
15:47 <@cjd> I want better control over the process.  
15:47 <vmassol> yep I've done that a bit  
15:48 <vmassol> I've modified the scripts  
15:48 <@cjd> I was working on breaking them into smaller scripts and then they can call one another after the bugs are all worked ouy.  
15:48 <@cjd> \*out  
15:48 <vmassol> I've done that already  
15:48 <@cjd> cool  
15:48 <@cjd> I'll have to checkout the release-scripts repo again  
15:49 <vmassol> https://gist.github.com/3104965  
15:49 <@cjd> +1

18:26 <vmassol> mflorea: I've just installed "github application" extension on 4.1.3 and 2 strange things as shown on http://www.evernote.com/shard/s119/sh/51177cee-d45c-4341-9e3a-fe99649caddc/f80483bdb8cd48a02c776f745ddf0780  
18:26 <vmassol> 1) I don't see the installed pages in the log  
18:26 <vmassol> 2) the install button is still there  
18:27 <vmassol> hmmm if I go tp installed ext it's not liste  
18:27 <vmassol> \*listed  
18:27 <+mflorea> they are not installed  
18:28 <+mflorea> looks like you don't have JS or the JS is obsolete  
18:28 <vmassol> I've reloaded though  
18:28 <+mflorea> hmm, if they are not listed in the installed extension then the install job wasn't triggered  
18:28 <vmassol> it was triggered  
18:28 <vmassol> as you can see in the logs  
18:28 <vmassol> (one line)  
18:29 <+mflorea> so something happened during the install  
18:29 <vmassol> isn't there a big try/catch around?  
18:29 <+tmortagne> according the log log you have it did not completed its task for sure at least  
18:29 <vmassol> ok I know the bug
